title: How to get a lucrative job in cybersecurity
description: There's a serious shortage of IT security workers, so recruiters are fishing in a bigger pool.

title: India's Covid doctors demand action after attacks
description: Doctors are seeking a stringent law to protect them from attacks by angry and frustrated relatives.

title: Riot of cherry blossom reveals new Damien Hirst post-lockdown
description: Giant cherry blossom paintings by Damien Hirst contrast with his previous dead animal art.

title: Bafta-nominated young game designers take on real-world issues
description: Bafta's nominees for Young Game Designer of the year tackle important issues for a new generation.

title: Covid-19: 'For us it's not freedom day, is it?'
description: Their medical conditions mean they are considered vulnerable to Covid. How are they feeling now?

title: Climate change: The craft brewery using algae to cut emissions
description: An Australian craft brewery is using microalgae to turn their carbon emissions into oxygen.

title: London air pollution turned into art to raise awareness
description: Marina Vitaglione used a traditional photographic process to create striking images of air pollution in London.

title: Is busking on TikTok the future?
description: Liv Harland live streams herself on TikTok and says she makes a lot more online than on the street.

title: Covid: The restrictions-easing dilemma facing Southwold
description: People in Southwold, a popular tourist destination, react to the restriction-easing measures.

title: PM, Whitty and Vallance on when they'll wear masks
description: Prof Chris Whitty and Sir Patrick Vallance explain the situations in which they'll still use face coverings.

title: Boris Johnson: 'If we can't reopen in next few weeks, when will we?'
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson speaks about the final step of England's roadmap out of lockdown.

title: On the verge of greatness - can Cavendish break Tour stage win record?
description: After an eventful week at the Tour de France, it's all falling Mark Cavendish's way, so what does he have to do to break Eddy Merckx's record?

title: Royals celebrate NHS anniversary with George Cross and tea party
description: The Queen awards the NHS the George Cross while Prince William attends a thanksgiving service.

title: Covid: Mask law and one metre rule set to end in England
description: Boris Johnson is ready to announce most remaining Covid restrictions can be eased from 19 July.

title: Curry set for Lions debut and Henderson named captain against Sharks
description: England flanker Tom Curry will make his British and Irish Lions debut and Ireland's Iain Henderson will captain the side against the Sharks on Wednesday.

title: My 'lovely' calves: Irish 10-year-old swaps cash prize for herd
description: Have you herd about the 10-year-old who's creating his own field of dreams after winning €1,000?

title: Ex-Hollyoaks star in hospital with 'horrific' Covid
description: Stephanie Davis, 28, who appeared in Hollyoaks from 2010-19, says she's "sick of being in pain".

title: Thomas considered withdrawing but will ride on in Tour de France
description: Geraint Thomas will carry on racing at the Tour de France having considered withdrawing after a tough opening week to this year's race.

title: Duchess of Cambridge forced to self-isolate due to Covid contact
description: Kensington Palace says the Duchess of Cambridge is not experiencing any coronavirus symptoms.

title: Ever Given: Egypt agrees deal to release ship that blocked Suez Canal
description: Egypt agrees a compensation deal with the impounded Ever Given's owners and insurers.

title: Jewish man abused twice in an hour on London transport network
description: The abusers were willing to target the man even though they knew they were on CCTV, his brother says.

title: Morrisons: Bidding war looms for supermarket as rivals circle
description: Apollo Global says it is considering a bid, days after the UK supermarket agreed to a £6.3bn takeover.

title: Soul Cap: Afro swimming cap Olympic rejection could be reconsidered after backlash
description: The governing body had told Soul Cap their hats don't follow "the natural form of the head".

title: Trafalgar Square Fourth Plinth: Winning artworks announced
description: The central London landmark has been home to a rolling commission of artworks since 1998.

title: Miami collapse: Remaining structure demolished over safety fears
description: The remaining section of the collapsed building is brought down as teams resume the search for victims.

title: Man Utd: Are Glazers making amends with Red Devils fans?
description: The Glazer ownership spoke directly to fans for the first time in their 16-year reign, but are fans convinced the relationship between them and the club will change?

title: Afghanistan: All foreign troops must leave by deadline - Taliban
description: The group's stance comes amid reports US forces will stay to protect embassies and an airport.

title: The Papers: PM to unveil unlocking plans, and 'George Cross for NHS'
description: Monday's papers lead with details of which measures are expected to be lifted in England after 19 July.

title: Jeff Bezos steps down as Amazon boss
description: As Bezos leaves his role as CEO, those who have worked with him ponder the lessons learned.
